column4: I'm having some serious issues with the vsftpd package that comes with ubuntu
whats the problem?
or any users for that matter
what does /var/log/vsftpd.log say
I've restarted it my config is http://rafb.net/paste/results/47cxth85.html
look in the vsftp log file for error
Wed Jan 11 14:22:18 2006 [pid 27989]  [pubuser]  FAIL LOGIN: Client "127.0.0.1"
thats all thats in there
well that and Wed Jan 11 14:22:12 2006 [pid 27990]  CONNECT: Client "127.0.0.1" right above it
yes, and Ive reset the passwd like 5 times to be sure
I can get shell just fine
hmm any other options you changed?
what I've got in pastebin is my exact config, pretty basic one
did you install vsftp with the package?
yeah in the basic repository for breezy with apt-get
I'll try that
ty :)
ofcourse it also has to be in /etc/pam.d
ok I'll mess with that. I do have a vsftpd in /etc/pam.d so I'll give it a whirl. thanks :)
gl
at least pam is nessecary for authentication
something is certainly out of whack. when I start it with /etc/init.d/vsftp start   it's running from a differen't pid than specified in the /var/run/vsftpd/vsftpd.pid =/
and I cleared out the stale one first after stopping it
maybe purge the package
